name: Butter Chicken
description: A creamy and rich chicken dish popular in Indian cuisine, made with a tomato and butter-based gravy.

name: Margherita Pizza
description: A classic Italian pizza topped with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, and basil.

name: Vegetable Fried Rice
description: Chinese-style fried rice cooked with mixed vegetables and flavorful sauces.

name: Paneer Tikka
description: Spiced and grilled chunks of paneer (Indian cottage cheese) served with mint chutney.

name: Mughlai Biryani
description: A rich and aromatic rice dish layered with marinated meat or vegetables and spices.

name: Chicken Shawarma
description: Middle Eastern dish featuring thinly sliced chicken wrapped in pita bread with vegetables and tahini sauce.

name: Chole Bhature
description: North Indian dish consisting of spicy chickpea curry served with deep-fried bread.

name: Gulab Jamun
description: An Indian dessert made from milk solids, deep-fried and soaked in sugar syrup.

name: Tom Yum Soup
description: A spicy and sour Thai soup with shrimp, mushrooms, and aromatic herbs.

name: Tandoori Chicken
description: Chicken marinated in yogurt and spices, roasted in a clay oven for a smoky flavor.

name: Pasta Alfredo
description: Creamy Italian pasta dish made with fettuccine and a rich Alfredo sauce.

name: Rasgulla
description: A popular Bengali dessert made from spongy balls of chhena soaked in sugar syrup.

name: Dosa
description: A thin, crispy crepe made from fermented rice and lentil batter, typically served with chutney and sambar.

name: Hyderabadi Biryani
description: A fragrant rice dish cooked with marinated meat (usually chicken or mutton) and aromatic spices.

name: Sambar
description: A lentil-based stew from South India, made with vegetables, tamarind, and spices, usually served with rice or dosa.

name: Pakhala Bhata
description: A traditional Bengali dish of fermented rice served with curd and accompaniments like fried fish.

name: Macher Jhol
description: A Bengali fish curry made with fresh fish, potatoes, and a variety of spices, typically served with rice.

name: Idli
description: Steamed rice cakes made from fermented rice and urad dal batter, commonly served with chutney and sambar.

name: Vada
description: A crispy, deep-fried doughnut-shaped snack made from urad dal, often paired with sambar.

name: Medu Vada
description: A popular South Indian snack made from black gram dal, deep-fried until golden and crispy, served with chutney.

name: Methi Thepla
description: A Gujarati flatbread made with fenugreek leaves, wheat flour, and spices, typically served with yogurt or pickle.

name: Bengali Mishti Doi
description: A sweetened yogurt dessert from Bengal, flavored with caramelized sugar.

name: Rogan Josh
description: A Kashmiri-style lamb curry cooked in a rich and aromatic gravy with various spices.

name: Pani Puri
description: A popular street food consisting of crispy hollow balls filled with spicy water, tamarind chutney, and potatoes.

name: Aloo Paratha
description: A stuffed flatbread made with whole wheat flour, filled with spiced mashed potatoes, typically served with yogurt and pickle.

name: Pav Bhaji
description: A Bombay street food consisting of mashed vegetable curry served with buttered pav (bread rolls).

name: Chana Masala
description: A hearty and spicy chickpea curry, typically served with rice or Indian bread like roti or naan.

name: Bhel Puri
description: A popular Indian snack made with puffed rice, vegetables, tamarind chutney, and spices.

name: Kadhi Pakora
description: A North Indian dish made from gram flour dumplings cooked in a yogurt-based gravy.

name: Momos
description: A type of Tibetan dumpling filled with vegetables or meat, often served with a spicy dipping sauce.

name: Kothu Parotta
description: A South Indian street food made by mixing shredded parotta with vegetables, meat, and spices.

name: Kheer
description: A traditional Indian dessert made from rice, milk, and sugar, flavored with cardamom and garnished with dry fruits.

name: Gobi Manchurian
description: A popular Indo-Chinese dish where cauliflower florets are deep-fried and tossed in a spicy, tangy sauce.

name: Samosa
description: A deep-fried pastry filled with spiced potatoes, peas, and sometimes meat, often served with chutney.

name: Lassi
description: A refreshing yogurt-based drink, available in sweet or salty versions, popular in Punjab.

name: Chili Paneer
description: A popular Indo-Chinese dish where paneer (Indian cottage cheese) is stir-fried with vegetables and a spicy sauce.

name: Kali Mirch Chicken
description: A spicy, pepper-flavored chicken curry that is a specialty of Indian cuisine.

name: Kachori
description: A deep-fried pastry filled with spiced lentils or peas, typically served as a snack or breakfast.

name: Pesarattu
description: A South Indian pancake made from green gram dal, typically served with ginger chutney.

name: Dhokla
description: A steamed savory cake made from fermented rice and chickpea flour, a popular snack in Gujarat.

name: Aloo Gobi
description: A dry curry made with potatoes and cauliflower, spiced with turmeric and garam masala.

name: Baingan Bharta
description: A smoky-flavored mashed eggplant curry made with tomatoes, onions, and spices.

name: Naan
description: A soft, leavened flatbread, typically served with curries or used to scoop up food.

name: Tandoori Roti
description: A type of Indian bread baked in a tandoor (clay oven), often served with curries.

name: Palak Paneer
description: A popular North Indian curry made from pureed spinach and paneer cubes.

name: Biryani
description: A spiced rice dish cooked with meat or vegetables, often served with yogurt or raita.

name: Methi Paratha
description: A flatbread made with fenugreek leaves, wheat flour, and spices, often served with yogurt or pickle.

name: Prawn Malai Curry
description: A Bengali dish made with prawns cooked in a creamy coconut-based gravy.

name: Shorshe Ilish
description: A traditional Bengali dish made with hilsa fish, cooked in mustard sauce.

name: Dhokla
description: A savory, steamed cake made from chickpea flour and spices, typically served with chutney.

name: Bhindi Masala
description: A dry curry made with ladyfinger (okra), onions, tomatoes, and Indian spices.

name: Puri
description: A round, deep-fried bread made from unleavened wheat flour dough, commonly served with curry.

name: Suran Ki Sabzi
description: A dry curry made from yam (suran), often cooked with onions, tomatoes, and Indian spices.

name: Litti Chokha
description: A traditional Bihari dish made of wheat flour balls stuffed with roasted gram flour and served with mashed vegetables.

name: Kadai Paneer
description: A spicy paneer curry made with bell peppers, onions, and tomatoes, cooked in a wok (kadai).

name: Schezwan Noodles
description: Spicy, stir-fried Chinese noodles with vegetables, flavored with Schezwan sauce.

name: Baked Samosa
description: A healthier variation of the classic samosa, baked instead of deep-fried.

name: Thali
description: A traditional Indian meal served on a round platter, with various small portions of different dishes.

name: Pongal
description: A South Indian dish made with rice, lentils, and black pepper, typically served with chutney and sambar.

name: Methi Malai Murg
description: A creamy chicken curry made with fenugreek leaves, cream, and a blend of aromatic spices.

name: Khaman
description: A Gujarati steamed snack made from fermented chickpea flour, served with chutney.

name: Kadhi
description: A yogurt-based curry typically served with rice, made with gram flour dumplings or vegetables.

name: Mapo Tofu
description: A spicy Chinese dish featuring tofu cooked in a sauce made with chili bean paste, garlic, and minced meat.

name: Egg Foo Young
description: A Chinese-style omelette made with vegetables, meats, and a savory brown gravy.

name: Fried Wontons
description: Crispy fried dumplings filled with meat or vegetables, often served with a dipping sauce.

name: Peking Duck
description: A famous Chinese dish featuring crispy duck served with thin pancakes, hoisin sauce, and sliced vegetables.

name: Steamed Fish with Ginger and Scallions
description: A delicately flavored dish where fish is steamed with fresh ginger, garlic, and scallions.

name: Mongolian Beef
description: A savory dish with sliced beef, onions, and a soy-based sauce, often cooked with ginger and garlic.
